name: Fire Control
description: Mastery of fire for warmth, cooking, protection, and altering landscapes.

name: Oral Tradition & Storytelling
description: Development of complex language for transmitting knowledge, culture, and history through spoken word and narratives.

name: Tribalism
description: Organization of society into small-scale kinship-based groups, establishing social cohesion, identity, and early forms of governance.

name: Stone Tool Making
description: Crafting basic tools from stone through percussion flaking (e.g., hand axes, scrapers).

name: Bone Tool Making
description: Crafting tools, needles, and points from animal bones, antlers, and ivory.

name: Basic Woodworking
description: Shaping wood for simple tools, shelters, and fire fuel.

name: Basic Tools
description: The foundational understanding and creation of a rudimentary toolkit from available materials like stone, wood, and bone.

name: Basic Shelter
description: Construction of rudimentary shelters from wood, bone, and hides for protection from elements.

name: Pigment Creation
description: Sourcing and processing natural materials (ochre, charcoal) to create pigments for art and decoration.

name: Early Symbolic Communication
description: Use of symbols, cave paintings, and petroglyphs for communication, ritual, and recording basic information.

name: Advanced Stone Tools
description: Refinement of stone tool technology, including polished stone tools, microliths, and more specialized implements.

name: Composite Tools
description: Combining materials like stone, bone, and wood (e.g., hafting axe heads, spears) using bindings.

name: Hunting & Gathering
description: Societies primarily sustained by foraging, hunting, and fishing, utilizing a diverse toolkit and deep ecological knowledge.

name: Animal Tracking & Signs
description: Interpreting animal tracks, trails, and other signs for hunting and understanding wildlife.

name: Horticulture
description: Small-scale, non-intensive cultivation of plants using simple tools; a transition between foraging and large-scale agriculture.

name: Plant Domestication
description: Systematic cultivation and selective breeding of wild plants for food, fiber, and other uses.

name: Basic Rope Making
description: Twisting plant fibers or animal sinew to create ropes and cords for various uses.

name: Basic Weaving and Basketry
description: Interlacing plant fibers or thin wood strips to create containers, mats, and simple fabrics.

name: Trapping
description: Using snares and pits to capture animals.

name: Fishing Nets & Hooks
description: Crafting nets and hooks from bone, wood, and fiber for efficient fishing.

name: Animal Domestication
description: Taming and selective breeding of animals for food, labor, or companionship.

name: Leather Working
description: Processing animal hides into leather for clothing, shelter, and containers.

name: Agriculture
description: The systematic cultivation of domesticated crops and rearing of animals, leading to food surpluses and settled societies.

name: Water Carrying Techniques
description: Methods for transporting water, e.g., using animal skins, gourds, or large leaves before pottery.

name: Clay Gathering and Preparation
description: Identifying, sourcing, and preparing clay by removing impurities and adding temper, making it suitable for pottery.

name: Pottery
description: Crafting vessels from fired clay for storage, cooking, and ritual.

name: Food Preservation (Drying, Salting)
description: Early methods of preserving food through drying with sun/fire or using salt, extending food availability.

name: Animal Husbandry
description: Systematic breeding, feeding, and raising of livestock for meat, milk, wool, and labor.

name: Basic Fermentation
description: Early techniques for preserving food and creating beverages (e.g., beer, wine, fermented dairy) through microbial action.

name: Herbalism
description: Use of plants for medicinal purposes based on observation and oral tradition.

name: Primitive Surgery (e.g., Trepanation)
description: Early forms of surgical intervention, often ritualistic or for relieving pressure, using basic tools.

name: Early Musical Instruments (Flutes, Drums)
description: Crafting simple instruments from wood, bone, or stretched hides for ritual, communication, or entertainment.

name: Ritual Burial Practices
description: Development of formal practices for interring the dead, often involving grave goods and symbolic acts, indicating abstract belief systems.

name: Early Boats
description: Construction of simple rafts and dugout canoes for crossing water bodies.

name: Basic Boat Propulsion (Paddles, Poles)
description: Manual methods for propelling early boats using paddles or poles.

name: Textiles & Weaving
description: Processing plant and animal fibers (flax, wool) into threads and weaving them into cloth on early looms.

name: Sailing
description: Use of wind-powered vessels with simple square sails for navigation across water.

name: Record Keeping
description: Early systems of tallying and recording information (e.g., knots, tokens, clay tablets) to manage surplus and trade.

name: Barter
description: The direct exchange of goods and services for other goods and services without a medium of exchange like money.

name: Bartering Systems & Early Trade
description: Establishment of regional trade networks based on bartering, exchanging surplus goods and rare materials over distances.

name: Early Astronomical Observation
description: Systematic observation of celestial bodies for timekeeping, navigation, and ritual.

name: Celestial Mythology & Constellations
description: Creation of stories and patterns based on celestial observations, forming early cosmologies.

name: Calendars
description: Systems for tracking time based on lunar and solar cycles, vital for agriculture and civil life.

name: Early Navigation
description: Basic coastal navigation using landmarks and celestial observation for seafaring.

name: Wheel
description: Invention of the wheel and axle, initially for pottery and later for transportation.

name: Archery
description: Use of bows and arrows for hunting and warfare.

name: Prospecting
description: The search for surface-level ore deposits, stones, or minerals. A precursor to systematic mining.

name: Mining
description: Extraction of valuable minerals and other geological materials from the Earth, initially from surface or shallow pits.

name: Masonry
description: Stone shaping and construction techniques for building durable structures, walls, and tombs.

name: Megalithic Construction
description: Building large structures using massive stones, often for ritual or monumental purposes, requiring significant social organization.

name: Fired Bricks & Early Kilns
description: Manufacturing durable building bricks from clay by firing them in kilns, allowing for larger and more complex buildings.

name: Early Fortifications
description: Construction of basic defensive structures like palisades and earthworks to protect settlements.

name: Irrigation
description: Controlled water management through canals and channels to support large-scale agriculture.

name: Horseback Riding
description: Using horses for travel, communication, and herding.

name: Charcoal Production
description: Creating charcoal by slowly heating wood in a low-oxygen environment, producing a fuel that burns hotter and cleaner than wood.

name: Basic Smelting
description: Using heat and a chemical reducing agent to extract a base metal from its ore. Requires hotter fires than basic kilns.

name: Copper Working
description: The extraction and working of copper, one of the first metals to be used by humans due to its presence in native form and low melting point.

name: Tin Working
description: The extraction and working of tin, a rare but essential component for creating bronze.

name: Bronze Working
description: Alloying copper and tin to create bronze, a hard and durable metal for superior tools, weapons, and armor.

name: Iron Working
description: Smelting iron ore at high temperatures to produce iron, a stronger and more abundant metal than bronze.

name: Writing
description: Development of symbolic systems to record language and complex information, moving from pictograms to scripts.
